title: Understanding Emotional Dysregulation
text: Emotional dysregulation refers to difficulties in managing and responding to emotional experiences in a socially acceptable manner.

title: Characteristics of Emotional Dysregulation
text: Consider how emotional dysregulation might manifest in everyday situations. It often involves intense emotional reactions and difficulty calming down.

hintAnswer: inability to manage or appropriately express emotions
title: Identifying Emotional Dysregulation
text: Which of the following best describes emotional dysregulation?
choices: subjective, emotional state characterized by antagonism toward someone or something perceived as causing harm or offense
aggression pertains to behaviors intended to harm or assert dominance over others
intentional use of physical force that results in injury, pain, or impairment
inability to manage or appropriately express emotions

poor communication skills, lack of empathy, perceived neglect, and rushed consultations that may frustrate clients and their families. An unfriendly and unsupportive attitude from the $$health-care$$ provider can trigger defensive mechanisms, such as anger and aggression
